intro: Endostemon dissitifolius, commonly known as the scattered-leaved endostemon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
